description: FDA pregnancy risk categories and safety information for medications

pregnancy_categories.description: Adequate and well-controlled studies have failed to demonstrate a risk to the fetus in the first trimester of pregnancy
pregnancy_categories.notes: Very few medications fall into this category

pregnancy_categories.description: Animal reproduction studies have failed to demonstrate a risk to the fetus and there are no adequate and well-controlled studies in pregnant women
Animal reproduction studies have shown an adverse effect on the fetus and there are no adequate and well-controlled studies in humans
pregnancy_categories.notes: Use only if potential benefit justifies potential risk

pregnancy_categories.description: There is positive evidence of human fetal risk, but the benefits from use in pregnant women may be acceptable despite the risk
pregnancy_categories.notes: Use only if no safer alternative exists

pregnancy_categories.description: Studies in animals or humans have demonstrated fetal abnormalities and/or there is positive evidence of human fetal risk
pregnancy_categories.notes: Should not be used during pregnancy

epilepsy_medication_categories.safety_notes: Generally considered safer for pregnancy, may require dose adjustments
Generally considered safer for pregnancy, good seizure control
High risk of birth defects, should be avoided if possible
Risk of neural tube defects, requires folic acid
Risk of fetal hydantoin syndrome, requires monitoring

general_guidelines: Folic acid supplementation (5mg daily) before conception
Consider medication changes before pregnancy if possible
Detailed anomaly scan at 18-20 weeks gestation
